reviews.text: Do you want more 5-star Google reviews? Best of all, theyâ€™re free! We can provide as many as you need to help your business reach the top of Google Maps. Contact us on Telegram: @gthisjpeg

Made the mistake of coming here again  hoping that the service would have improved. Unfortunately, it hasnâ€™t. The same waitress that was rude the first time was equally rude and unhelpful again. Two strikes -  thatâ€™s it.

First and foremost, I want to say as a NYC foodie, to make a place as great as their food is the staff. With that being sent, each & every time  I hope I get the waitress named Andrea. Waitressing at its finest. She was attentive, FRIENDLY and as a table of 5, she read everything on that menu as if she was making it for us herself! She also knew which drinks we would like just by us telling her very little about our taste! So professional and QUICK ON HER FEET! We will definitely be coming back and telling everyone we know, not only for the food but for her! We had all ordered the steak, three well done (DONE RIGHT THE FIRST TIME MIGHT I ADD) which is difficult in many restaurant. Two medium rare and not one complaint from anyone at our table. Iâ€™m also going to tell my friends at their magazine to come check this out! Also the outside was very nice and neat! Would love to sit back there again!

Hello Enrique & Alana <3
This is a great place!
Delicious food, drinks and warm &  inviting atmosphere
Will definitely be back

From the moment you walk in, you can feel the heart behind this place. The owners are incredible â€“ warm, present, and clearly invested in making every guest feel at home. You donâ€™t just get great service here, you feel genuinely taken care of.

The food is outstanding. Every dish is fresh, flavorful, and clearly made with care. You can tell they actually love what they do. And the drinks? Absolutely perfect â€“ balanced, creative, and just what you want whether youâ€™re having a casual night out or celebrating something special.

One of the best parts: itâ€™s truly amazing for families. So many places claim that, but Luanaâ€™s actually delivers. Relaxed atmosphere, welcoming staff, and something delicious for everyone.

Simply put: incredible owners, amazing food, perfect drinks, and genuinely family-friendly. Luanaâ€™s is the kind of place you want to come back to again and again.

Came here for brunch with no wait without reservation. Everything looked good. Enjoyed the breakfast smashburger. Also had the pancakes which were out of this world. Fluffy and crispy edge. Waited a little long for the dessert and they ended comping us anyway.
We had the after party for our wedding here and it was a blast! Service was amazing, and the vibe indoor and outdoors is great. The patio is huge and the bar is beautiful.

Our dinner here made my entire trip to NYC/Brooklyn. From the service, to the food and drinks, to the atmosphere and ambiance, it was perfect - no notes. The owners are so gracious and are clearly actively involved in the day to day of the restaurant. Many of the clientele seemed to know one another or spot friends while there. It truly felt like a local, neighborhood spot that any neighborhood in any city in the country would be lucky to have. Food and cocktails were top notch. This will be a must on all my future trips to the area. Thank you to Enrique and your team for a fantastic and memorable evening!

I liked this place a lot.  The have a nice area for outdoor seating.  Inside is comfortable also.  It's an airy space.  Very family oriented.  The Cocktails are wonderful.  I had the Smoke Show, it was delicious.  The Tavern fries were very good, with perfect crispness.  The prices are reasonable.  I would return to try other items on the menu

I made a reservation for 6 plus a baby for 6pm on a Saturday. I donâ€™t know if they overbooked or what, but we were shoved at a small table right next to the kids little play area - which was awful. Kids run around without any supervision, throwing toys and climbing walls, itâ€™s literally anarchy (and I have a kid!). It took 25 minutes to get our drinks (and another ten after that to get a club soda), 45 minutes to get our food, and they completely forgot one meal. Our server came back once an hour if we were lucky. There were people hovering by our table standing and drinking, and we had to ask the staff twice to please ask them to move so we could eat without their butts in our faces. The whole experience was bizarre, the food was mediocre at best (and not worth the price or the wait). I will not be back, and I will be sure to tell others of our experience, because YIKES, guys.
Highly recommend! Thank you !

A couple of weeks ago, we had the Welcome Party for my daughter's wedding on the patio at Luana's. It was fabulous! Alana was extremely flexible and aimed to please. She was easy to work with, relaxed and very accommodating. Without hesitation, she worked with me to ensure that she stayed within my budget. All the food was great and plenitful; from the passed hors D'oeuvres, to the entree platters, to the giant soft baked chocolate chip cookies for dessert. At the start of the event, Alana and Enrique (the owners), came out to see if there was anything we needed to make sure the party met our expectations. They even insisted on providing wine for my husband and I to drink that pleased our palates. Our friends and family loved the vibe at Luana's and raved about the food and drinks. It set the tone for what was a memorable wedding weekend!
Lackluster food and drinks, meager portions and pours, high prices, super slow service, soporific scene. Cannot believe all the great reviews this place has. The tacos were nice.
Delicious food, wonderful service !

The food here is moderate, the servings are small, the service is terrible and everything is crazy expensive. I think the main problem is that they have way more seating than the kitchen can accommodate and also the prices are too high. You can go to Marco Polo and pay the same but get treated like royalty with better food.
Great atmosphere, but unfortunately poor service.

Beautiful classic bar area that lets in a ton of light. The interior dining area is huge with a nice back area. The outside seating is great and the canopy that covers the area is a huge plus. The servers and hostess are incredibly nice and accommodating as well.

The food ranges all over the place and everything looked and tasted amazing. Smash burger was out of this world.
I really didnâ€™t enjoy the service here. Our order took almost an hour to arrive. By the time the food finally came, it was already cold. Definitely disappointing and not worth the wait.
Good
Best service in Brooklyn
Best Guinness Iâ€™ve had in BK west of prospect park. Owner and staff were very attentive. Great outdoor patio. A neighborhood gem.
Really great service here, owner is really nice. Will def return
Had the perfect weekend brunch on the garden patio! Breezy, warm weather. Cappuccino with oat milk was perfect. Hubby and I shared Ricotto Lemon Pancakes and Eggs Benedict with Smoked Salmon.
Attentive and knowledgeable and friendly staff, great outdoor space. You feel home.  I definitely have to go back there.  Great Martiniâ€™s

Pretty, laidback restaurant with convenient indoor & outdoor seating. The menu is decent but the food taste was hit or miss. I liked the fried chicken sandwich, fish & chips, corn cobs but the Thai chicken salad was subpar. Drinks are very good. Give it a try for lunch or early dinner.

Came in for an early dinner and had a lovely experience. The servers are welcoming and the food is tasty. The salmon with Shishito peppers is especially delicious but the fish and chips are also note worthy. The space itself is nice too with a lot of outdoor seating. Overall Luellaâ€™s is a great place for a nice meal and relaxing vibe.
The Thai Chicken salad is so tasty. A must have.
Incredible burgers!

Came here on Motherâ€™s Day with a reservation and everything. We had to wait a while to order, which is fine. Then the wait for our food was OVER an hour. Even for our appetizer (scones). It came ONE + hour later. With no check-ins from our waiter. My momâ€™s first time in BK & it wasnâ€™t a great experience. I understand it was a holiday but the restaurant was not full and there were a ton of staff around. Just a simple check in or letting us know there was a long wait would have gone a long way- but they just avoided our table and said nothing. Food was decent but the service really spoiled it.

I loved my first visit here - the food was so delicious (I got the chicken sandwich and tavern fries!) and the staff is all so friendly. I love the story of this place and that it is family owned - you can tell they care about their customers! I sat outside and they had good music playing, a great atmosphere, and a big screen to watch the yankee game, and they are also super kid friendly and had toys and space for the kids to play outside which I thought was great! Growing up we always went to restaurants like that but I havenâ€™t seen a place so kid-friendly in a while! I will definitely be back :)
Excellent food, great service, nice atmosphere. Really glad to have stumbled on this restaurant while in town for a nearby function. Highly recommended!
This place made my daughterâ€™s entire year! Awesome food, great service.

We had our wedding reception here and it was an amazing experience. Alana was great to work with, and all of the staff were so hospitable and attentive. Delicious food, reasonably priced drink (and total event) package, and the bar/outside areas are impossible to beat. Thank you for making our special day so memorable!
Really cool space. Definitely coming back! We watched Albania vs Serbia game for World Club on a huge screen.
My husband & I were walking around the area & decided to pop in here. Food was great & so was the staff.
Tasty food and good drinks

We had a family early dinner Friday.  Our ages range from 80 years old to 2 years old.  We had a great time.  Luanaâ€™s is a welcoming and warm experience.  We had terrific tasting smash burgers.  The vibe is great there.

We had dinner here and the food was absolutely delicious, very nice staff working here. Great atmosphere, even had to order seconds to take home. Compliments to the chef, well deserved. ðŸ†ðŸ’¯ Thank you.â€¦
Good food, drinks, and atmosphere.

Went for the burger, stayed for the corn ribs.

Spacious bar area with a huge outdoor space and additional seating in the back. They also have an excellent draft selection - shout out to Other Half Brewing Co.

This family owned and operated business is a local gem that must be protected at all costs. In the sometimes transactional world of restaurants Luanaâ€™s team care. They care about their food, they care about your cocktail and most importantly they care about you.

Great spot to catch a game and kids are always happy to go with their euro style kids area so parents can relax and enjoy.

Bravo bravo bravo â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

Luanaâ€™s Tavern has a great vibe and is definitely worth checking out if youâ€™re in the neighborhood. One of the standout features is the large amount of outdoor seatingâ€”itâ€™s perfect for enjoying a meal on a nice day without feeling cramped. The service was impressively fast and genuinely friendly, which added a welcoming touch to the experience.

As for the food, it was just okay. While everything was cooked well and presented nicely, most of the dishes seriously lacked flavor, which was a bit of a letdown. That said, the overall atmosphere and service made the visit enjoyable enough that Iâ€™d still consider coming backâ€”hopefully the kitchen tightens up the seasoning next time.

A true hidden gem of the neighborhood (or the entire Brooklyn!). My family lives 2 subway stops away from this place and I've been there 3 times in the last month.

First of all, the food is AMAZING. This place is so unassuming because it't just a pub, however, every dish we have ordered is super on point. For example, the pork chop was thick and the sauce was creamy, tasty with a hint of acidity from the roasted apples. They do classics but do it very, very well. Even the pave potatoes that goes on the side of the steak are amazing and very technique driven. We were very impressed.

Second of all, the service is really on point. The owner, Enrique, is a true family man and this place is very kid-friendly as well.

Lastly, I really like the wine list that they have as well. Very well put together and you know they put in good work for it.

All and all, a must try for anyone in Brooklyn looking for a great meal in a casual setting.
Good food and space, but I felt rushed during the brunch service. The waitress reminded us that a big party was coming in and to put our food order in fast
Food was great. Staff was friendly
Very expensive for brunch. $10 for a side of bland fries that were not crispy nor seasoned. Service was good at least.
Went to a private family gathering of about 20 people. Service was great. Large private room available. Even vegetarian options.

It took a while to get our food but mainly because there were so many people. The fish and chips were delicious, the kids pasta was not great but next time I come here Iâ€™m ordering a burger. The servers were so nice and I would totally come back.
Good beer selection and food was OK but super pricey. $28 for a hamburger.

Delicious food and drinks, friendly staff, tight space , avoid on weekends if you like your personal space.. being bumped into a few times at the high top bar stool ticked me off.. however it is a nice spot and I did enjoy myself

Iâ€™m always on the lookout for a great place for brunch, and Iâ€™m always looking for a place that has pancakes on their menu. When I discovered that they have ricotta pancakes, I had to go for brunch. I chose the perfect Saturday to go. It was a beautiful day with beautiful weather. When I first laid eyes on the restaurant, I loved how it had plenty of outdoor seating. It was not busy when I entered and I was able to sit wherever I wanted. My waitress Andrea provided great service. She was very nice! I ordered a cup of coffee and started off with Franks in a blanket. They were yummy. They came with two sauces to dip them in. Then I got the Ricotta Pancakes. They were very delicious. Light and fluffy! I I ordered a side order of scrambled eggs which were yummy as well. I almost wanted to order the PB&J French Toast because it sounded so good. Next time! My waitress Andrea complimented me on my order. She said she also would have picked out the exact items like I did for her meal. I was pleasantly surprised on how many families started to come into the restaurant after me. Thatâ€™s when I realized how family-friendly this restaurant is. I even saw a lot of people bring in their dogs. That was very nice. Overall, I had a very pleasant experience and I would definitely come back again because there were so many things I still want to try out. I saw on instagram that they serve a great steak. So I gladly recommend this restaurant to everyone.

My friend and I went to Luana's Tavern at 6pm on a Wednesday. I made a reservation, but it was not necessary for the outdoor space. I was not super attentive to what was going on inside, but it also did not appear to be packed. We took advantage of the beautiful weather and the outdoor vibes were fantastic! My only small issue was they seated another party of two immediately near us when there were plenty of open tables available.

I got the smash burger ($23) and my friend got the wild mushroom pappardelle ($21). We split a brownie sundae, but I didn't inquire about the price. My friend enjoyed the pappardelle and had no complaints. I thought the fries were done better than the burger but the dish itself is nothing special, especially for a $23 price point. The patties on the smash burger are so thin they have to cook it medium, and nothing about the sauce or flavor on the meat was outstanding. The brownie in the sundae was also on the dry side, slightly compensated for by the ice cream, but also unimpressive.

Service was phenomenal, and I wish I caught the server's name so I could recommend her! She did very frequent check backs but in a friendly, not pushy, manner. Overall, I would recommend Luana's if you're looking for a more upscale dining spot with decent food and excellent vibes.

We held our wedding â€œwelcome partyâ€ (cocktails and appetizers) at Luanaâ€™s the night before our wedding and had the best experience. The bar, back room, and outdoor patio were beautiful for photos and mingling. The food was fantastic and staff were all so kind and helpful. Highly recommend this beautiful, family run venue!

Had the best time here! The manager Enrique doesn't even know that he made my night. I took myself out on date and was at another place that couldn't accommodate me. I'm observing Ramadan and broke my fast and was ready to eat but couldn't at the other place. I left there and found Luana's. Although Luana's was packed Enrique accommodated me and gave me a table. Andrea the server was on it too.

They had no idea that I had a bad experience elsewhere and they became my saviors! I will definitely be going back to Lunana's. Oh and the food and dessert was on point!

AMERICAN COLLEGE BARS,
circa early Reagan presidency, must be the model for this lively neighborhood eatery. The menu has evolved to match contemporary tastes and middle-aged budgets, the loos are much more tidy, and cocktails culture never imagined in the 1980s is now central at Luanaâ€™s. Sorry, no buckets of bottled Bud Light. Instead, on a  July Friday evening in 2024, the oysters were savory and enhanced with house sauces; the Tavern Burger was enough for two post graduates. The venue has tin ceilings, an inviting old bar and a big outdoor cafe filled with diners drawn by a very capable band. Service was welcoming.

Laidback neighborhood American spot that sources meats from local butchers. The food is surprisingly good with a solid chicken sandwich thatâ€™s crisp and saucy along with good fries. Honestly itâ€™s the type of restaurant that should be in every part of the city, definitely worth a visit if youâ€™re in the area!

The staff were just amazing. Adele was our server who just shined. We took a liking to her right away, she made us feel very welcome. The owners and managers of the establishment also passed by a few times to check on us and were the nicest people Iâ€™ve probably dealt with in a Resturant environment. Even the chef came out and I had to thank him on a meal well prepared. The food was just pure perfection. The taste, the temperature, the texture. I ordered the stake, medium rare, it tasted amazing and practically melted in my mouth, very well marinated. The burger had flavor which is rare to find these days. My friends each ordered something and every single one of them said the same thing, it was great. The drinks were so good that we just kept ordering more. Glad to know their bartender knows what theyâ€™re doing. If the food stays this good and the customer service stays this good as well, they will be seeing a lot more of me. Highly recommended to all.

Luana's Tavern is an absolute gem! The ricotta pancakes are a must-tryâ€”fluffy, rich, and perfectly balanced with just the right amount of sweetness. They practically melt in your mouth and are a delightful treat any time of day. Beyond the incredible food, the atmosphere is warm and inviting, with a cozy charm that makes you feel right at home. The staff are friendly and attentive, adding to the overall experience. Whether you're stopping by for breakfast or a leisurely weekend brunch, Luana's Tavern is a place you'll want to return to again and again. Highly recommend!

The service and food were very nice. Had a local spot vibe with 5 star feel. The food was delicious.
We ordered for apps
shrimp tacos
duck wings
. Both had great flavor and perfectly cooked. Would recommend.

Dinner we order the tavern burger. The meat was perfect cooked! 10/10. I understand why people are saying this is a top burger in Brooklyn.

Dessert we got the brownie sundae. Great way to end the meal

Overall we had a great time and it felt like a family first restaurant. Canâ€™t wait to go back

We hosted a friendâ€™s bridal shower brunch at Luanaâ€™s Tavern. Our event was originally booked with the previous restaurant at this location, but Alana and the team were very accommodating to our large group of 21, were flexible with our dietary restrictions, and were helpful in figuring out the right arrangements for our event when ownership changed over. All of the guests loved the location and the outdoor patio. We were thankful for the awning as it was a hot summer day and it was nice to have the shade. Our event menu included mimosas and Bellinis with fresh juices (you could taste the difference!) the BLT salad, mushroom toast, pancakes, avocado toast and sliders (and donuts for dessert from Brandonâ€™s Donuts located next door). I thinks the two toasts and pancakes were the fan favorites, but everything was delicious. An extra shout out to the servers who were efficient and attentive!

That Tavern Burger hitðŸ‘…!  So good. Seasoned perfectly, love the bun!
We also loved our Manhattan on the rocks! Paige is the best! We also had fun chatting with the regulars at the bar.
Looking forward to our next visit.

I'm very excited about the change in this restaurant from the last people who had it to now. The food was quite good.

We need more neighborhood  restaurants with a nice variety of dishes on the menu at a reasonable price. Luana's fits the bill.

We had the duck wings, mushroom toasts, the corn ribs, the steamed clams, the asparagus with quinoa,  and  the tuna nicoise salad. For the most part, the food was very well executed.

Duck wings were very tasty and I loved the presentation. There was a very interesting sauce under the duck wings which I was told was hoisin and mayonnaise but didn't really taste like that combo.

There was a nice assortment of mushrooms on the mushroom toast.

Corn ribs were fun and tasty.

The clams were perfectly cooked but the sauce was a bit bland. I couldn't taste much garlic in it even though I could see it.

They went a little hard with the preserved lemon in the quinoa on the asparagus. The quinoa was kind of dull-looking and only had the preserved lemon in it. I would have like there'd be some fresh herbs and or scallions or chives in it to break up the beige and add a little more flavor, contrast, and texture

I love how beautifully cooked tuna was in the nicoise salad but the fish itself could have used some more dressing.

The only thing we didn't care for was the Cherry Pie. The crust was fine but the filling was really thick and gluggy without any of the acidicity you'd expect in a fruit pie.

The antique bar is gorgeous.
This place was very loud inside. We were sitting right under the speaker. There was live music outside the night we were there.

Our server was charming and gracious, if not the most efficient but he got it together in the end.

We would definitely go back.

My friends and I had the best time at Luanaâ€™s. Our server Malachi was the perfect amount of attentive and friendly, and the food was amazing. We loved seeing the owners kids running around, definitely added to the atmosphere even though we were there without kids. The food and drinks were amazing, big fans of the pumpkin spice espresso martinis and wine selection. Canâ€™t wait to come back!

I'm happy ðŸ˜Š to discover such a gem! The atmosphere is great with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. The food is amazing, and the service makes you feel right at home! I look forward to spending the summer here.

Everything about our experience throwing our party here was excellent! The owners were incredibly attentive, available, and accommodating. The food is great. The space is great. If you want to adult with your friends in a space thatâ€™s kind to kids, this is the place for you. We had 40 people there from 4-6:30 for a party and it was perfect. Highly recommend it for brunch, lunch, dinner and for your special occasion.

Nice local pub with a laid back atmosphere and cozy dining areas.  The broccoli is cooked perfectly with just the right amount of a very high-quality garlic.  The smash burger is quite interesting especially with the cooked egg on top.  The pub fries are fresh hand cut potatoes, not from frozen like most places.  Very enjoyable.
My favorite spot for dinner!! Their take on a Mickie Dees smash burger is PERFECT BUT DONT SLEEP on their chicken dinner with fries and gravy itâ€™s the perfect meal:)

Luanaâ€™s has quickly become my go-to restaurant! I have been stopping in quite a bit because of how consistently good it is; it hits all the right notes for a casual dinner and drinks, but also is stand out to the point where I make an effort to bring my out of town friends through.

The food is the stand out: in my opinion, it far outshines the majority of the places in the neighborhood, especially at the price. Everything is crafted with care, and several dishes are stand out: the smash burger, the pork chop, even the fries: theyâ€™re done right. You can tell that the chef knows their stuff.

And then there is the service. The staff have taken time to get to know me, and they clearly strive to make it an atmosphere that is family first. Let me tell yaâ€¦ I feel like family. They ask about my pets, they see me in the neighborhood and say hi, they know me and my tastes and are able to recommend stuff for me to order.

Iâ€™m so glad Luanaâ€™s opened. Itâ€™s a neighborhood standout that is appropriate for a quick bite, a night of drinking, an intimate celebration â€” and I canâ€™t recommend it enough.

This place has the best avocado toast this side of Brooklyn. Everything is super fresh the bread is just right and all the flavors blend perfectly together. I wish I could have ordered more options but the portion was huge.
I had a dinner with my friends and we really enjoyed with food and drinks, also live music made environment more pleasant. Recommended. Iâ€™ll visit the place again pretty soon. â¤ï¸

Warm, friendly neighborhood restaurant with seriously good food and amazing service.

Everything on the menu is great so you really should just order what you like.

For me at brunch, steak and eggs or pancakes. At dinner I like their burger, their salmon (itâ€™s that good!), and the steak. My kids love the franks in a blanket and I think my wife could live on just the French onion soup.

Note the new owner was a huge upgrade here.
